definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To imprison somebody, usually without trial.
examples: The US government interned thousands of Japanese-Americans during World War II.

subdefinitions.definition: ( of a state , especially a neutral state ) To confine or hold (foreign military personnel who stray into the state's territory) within prescribed limits during wartime.
examples: The Swiss government interned the Italian soldiers who had strayed onto Swiss territory.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To imprison somebody, usually without trial.

definitions.definition: To work as an intern, usually with little or no pay or other legal prerogatives of employment, and for the purpose of furthering a program of education.
examples: I'll be interning at Universal Studios this summer.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To work as an intern, usually with little or no pay or other legal prerogatives of employment, and for the purpose of furthering a program of education.
